This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=GEOLSOC-HE.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-12T09:43:26Z Alison Stokes 2015-03-12T09:43:15+00:00 2015-03-12T09:43:15+00:00 New HEN event: Confronting Barriers to Inclusion: Opening the Gate to Accessible Fieldwork https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOLSOC-HE;b02e3ec8.1503 Colleagues,<br><br>I'm pleased to announce that registration is now open for the following event, which is being co-organised by HEN and CHUGD (Committee of Heads of University Geosciences Departments).<br><br>Confronting Barriers to Inclusion: Opening the Gate to Accessible Fieldwork<http://www.geolsoc.org.uk/Accessible-Fieldwork-Meeting><br><br>Date: Friday 26 June 2015, 9.30am - 5.00pm, followed by a networking wine reception.<br>Venue: The Geological Society, Burlington House<br>Registration: \ufffd\ufffd20 [...] Tom Argles 2015-02-08T17:48:20+00:00 2015-02-08T17:48:20+00:00 Virtual field trip service, anyone? https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOLSOC-HE;3714c85e.1502 As part of an InnovateUK-funded project, we are testing the idea of a \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdVirtual Field Trip creation service\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd to create virtual field trips in a gaming engine environment, to support and/or replicate physical world field trips. Users would be able to add their own sites, and add new lesson plans to existing locations. I should stress we are NOT intending to replace field teaching; far from it! [...] Patrick Rickles 2015-02-02T18:39:58+00:00 2015-02-02T18:39:58+00:00 RGS-IBG AC 2015 Final CfP - GIS and the Anthropocene: Educational Perspectives https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOLSOC-HE;d79dfbd7.1502 *Apologies for Cross Posting - FINAL CALL FOR PAPERS*<br><br>Abstracts are invited for a session jointly sponsored by the GIScience Research Group (GIScRG) and the Higher Education Research Group (HERG) at the Royal Geographical Society \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Institute of British Geographers International Conference 2015. The conference runs between 2nd \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 4th September, 2015 at the University of Exeter\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Streatham Campus in Exeter, Devon. [...] Jamie Pringle 2015-01-23T10:43:47+00:00 2015-01-23T10:43:47+00:00 Re: Geol Soc HEN conference 2015 - programme https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOLSOC-HE;4c2beb2b.1501 Hi Chris,<br>Here's my diss that I suggested may be useful to evaluate your course? Feel<br>free to delete if not!<br>Best,<br>Jamie.<br><br>On 22 January 2015 at 17:46, Satow, Christopher G <C.Satow@kingston.ac.uk><br>wrote:<br><br>> I'd like to echo Geraint's comments here. The HEN conference was one of<br>> the most helpful and enjoyable conferences I've been to- a great mix of<br>> really useful topics, and delegates who were open to sharing expertise,<br>> advice and knowledge.<br>><br>><br>><br>> Many thanks all!<br>><br>> Best wishes,<br>><br>><br>><br>> Chris Satow<br>><br>> Lecturer in Physical [...] Satow, Christopher G 2015-01-22T17:46:38+00:00 2015-01-22T17:46:38+00:00 Re: Geol Soc HEN conference 2015 - programme https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOLSOC-HE;6a54caef.1501 I'd like to echo Geraint's comments here. The HEN conference was one of the most helpful and enjoyable conferences I've been to- a great mix of really useful topics, and delegates who were open to sharing expertise, advice and knowledge.<br><br>Many thanks all!<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Chris Satow<br><br>Lecturer in Physical Geography, Kingston University - 02084 172950 (or ext:62950)<br>Associate Lecturer, The Open University<br>"Everyday we burn more biomass in the form of fossil fuels than the Earth produces in an entire year" BBC Human Universe 28th Oct 2014 Owen G. 2015-01-22T14:20:07+00:00 2015-01-22T14:20:07+00:00 Re: Geol Soc HEN conference 2015 - programme https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOLSOC-HE;5ffc98f8.1501 Hi Alison<br><br>Just a quick note to thank you very much (and others who were involved) for an excellent day of talks and discussion yesterday. It was really stimulating and thought-provoking and everything seemed to run smoothly. A minor point - but always important - the catering was really good!<br><br>I'm already looking forward to HEN16, and I hope today's session went as well as yesterday's. The conference runs between 2nd \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 4th September, 2015 at the University of Exeter\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Streatham Campus in Exeter, Devon. [...] Alison Stokes 2014-12-15T10:30:27+00:00 2014-12-15T10:30:27+00:00 Geol Soc HEN conference 2015 - programme https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOLSOC-HE;bbe5e913.1412 **PLEASE FORWARD AS APPROPRIATE**<br><br>We are delighted to announce the programme for the forthcoming 2015 Geol Soc HEN Annual Meeting at Plymouth University (see attached).<br><br>Presentations for the Annual Meeting (Jan 21st) will cover a broad range of educational practice across the GEES disciplines, in additional to two specially-invited keynotes and the opportunity to participate in a topical lunchtime discussion. [...] Alison Stokes 2014-11-20T15:45:59+00:00 2014-11-20T15:45:59+00:00 FW: GEOSPHERE - Call for Special Issue on Human Dimensions in Geoscience https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOLSOC-HE;91868eab.1411 See the following for a great opportunity to publish geoscience research with a strong human / social element.<br><br>Alison<br><br>Dr Alison Stokes<br>Lecturer in Earth and Environmental Science Education<br>School of Geography, Earth and Environmental Sciences, Plymouth University, Plymouth, PL4 8AA<br><br>Tel: 01752 584889<br>Email: alison.stokes@plymouth.ac.uk<br>Personal webpage: http://www.plymouth.ac.uk/staff/astokes Alison Stokes 2014-11-19T09:15:31+00:00 2014-11-19T09:15:31+00:00 Geol Soc HEN Annual Meeting - additional Digimap workshop available https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOLSOC-HE;357f05c2.1411 We have received a great selection of abstracts for the forthcoming HEN conference and e-gaming workshop. However, if anyone would still like to offer a poster please submit a brief abstract via the conference website by Monday 1st December. Full details about the meeting and instructions for submission can be found on the conference website: https://www5.plymouth.ac.uk/whats-on/geological-society-conference-sharing-educational-practice-in-the-geosciences. [...] Alison Stokes 2014-11-06T10:39:55+00:00 2014-11-06T10:39:55+00:00 Re: REMINDER: submit your abstract for the next Geol Soc HEN Annual Meeting! https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOLSOC-HE;8461d8f5.1411 Yes\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd.but not a lot more at the moment, hence the reminder!!<br><br>Alison<br><br>From: Geological Society of London Higher Education Network [mailto:GEOLSOC-HE@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Jamie Pringle<br>Sent: 06 November 2014 10:22<br>To: GEOLSOC-HE@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: REMINDER: submit your abstract for the next Geol Soc HEN Annual Meeting!<br><br>You have my two dont you Alison?<br>Best,<br>Jamie.<br><br>On 6 November 2014 09:07, Alison Stokes <alison.stokes@plymouth.ac.uk<mailto:alison.stokes@plymouth.ac.uk>> wrote:<br>A reminder that the abstract deadline for the next Geol Soc Higher Education Network Annual Meeting and follow-up workshop on e-gaming is Friday 14th November. Full details about the meeting and instructions for submission can [...] Jamie Pringle 2014-11-06T10:21:44+00:00 2014-11-06T10:21:44+00:00 Re: REMINDER: submit your abstract for the next Geol Soc HEN Annual Meeting! https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOLSOC-HE;cd5d2382.1411 You have my two dont you Alison?<br>Best,<br>Jamie.<br><br>On 6 November 2014 09:07, Alison Stokes <alison.stokes@plymouth.ac.uk><br>wrote:<br><br>> A reminder that the abstract deadline for the next Geol Soc Higher<br>> Education Network Annual Meeting and follow-up workshop on e-gaming is *Friday<br>> 14th November*. Full details about the meeting and instructions for<br>> submission can be found on the conference website:<br>> https://www5.plymouth.ac.uk/whats-on/geological-society-conference-sharing-educational-practice-in-the-geosciences.<br>><br>><br>><br>><br>> With a broad theme of *sharing educational practice in the geosciences*<br>> this meeting aims to provide a forum for lively, informed debate between<br>> teachers, students, practitioners, employers and [...] Alison Stokes 2014-11-06T09:07:33+00:00 2014-11-06T09:07:33+00:00 REMINDER: submit your abstract for the next Geol Soc HEN Annual Meeting! https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOLSOC-HE;8168a478.1411 A reminder that the abstract deadline for the next Geol Soc Higher Education Network Annual Meeting and follow-up workshop on e-gaming is Friday 14th November. Full details about the meeting and instructions for submission can be found on the conference website: https://www5.plymouth.ac.uk/whats-on/geological-society-conference-sharing-educational-practice-in-the-geosciences.<br><br>With a broad theme of sharing educational practice in the geosciences this meeting aims to provide a forum for lively, informed debate between teachers, students, practitioners, employers and other stakeholders on higher education practice in the GEES disciplines. We welcome contributions on any aspect of GEES higher education, including: [...] Alison Stokes 2014-10-10T10:06:20+00:00 2014-10-10T10:06:20+00:00 HEN 2015 Annual Meeting - registration now open! https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOLSOC-HE;b35ed34d.1410 Registration is now open for the 2015 Geol Soc HEN Annual Meeting. Full details and links to online registration can be found on the conference webpage: http://www5.plymouth.ac.uk/whats-on/geological-society-conference-sharing-educational-practice-in-the-geosciences.<br><br>We're keen to encourage participation from across the GEES disciplines, so please feel free to circulate our conference details to any other groups or lists that might be interested. [...] Alison Stokes 2014-09-24T08:02:23+00:00 2014-09-24T08:02:23+00:00 HEN 2015 call for papers https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOLSOC-HE;21fe8f6b.1409 Plymouth University will be hosting the next HEN Annual Meeting, which has a general theme of Sharing Educational Practice in the Geosciences. This meeting aims to provide a forum for lively, informed debate between teachers, students, practitioners, employers and other stakeholders on higher education practice in the GEES disciplines.<br><br>Date: Annual Meeting: Wednesday 21st January 2015<br>Post-meeting workshop: Thursday 22nd Jan 2015<br>Venue: Plymouth University [...] Mike Smith 2014-07-18T10:34:19+01:00 2014-07-18T10:34:19+01:00 Journal of Maps: Geology Maps 2012-13 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOLSOC-HE;f733df46.1407 Dear all<br><br>As part of our efforts to make people aware of geology related papers published in the Journal of Maps please find listed below (with DOI URLs) those relevant papers from 2012-14. Volumes 1-7 and Volume 8 Issue 1 are free-to-access, with other issues subscription based.<br><br>Best Wishes<br><br>mike<br><br>2012-14<br>=======<br>Plets, Clements, Quinn, Strong,2012,Marine substratum map of the Causeway Coast, Northern Ireland,8,1,1,13,http://dx.doi.org/10.1080/17445647.2012.661957 [...] Alison Stokes 2014-07-14T08:17:40+00:00 2014-07-14T08:17:40+00:00 Geoscience education sessions at GSA https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOLSOC-HE;f0a8c36c.1407 Colleagues,<br><br>For anyone heading to GSA this year, there are a broad range of geoscience education related sessions planned which are seeking abstracts. The following might be of particular interest and/or relevance:<br><br>T52. Preparing Our Workforce (POW): Increasing Students' Employability by Developing Practical Skills and Competencies<br>Retirement of professionals is causing an increased demand for trained geoscientists in the private sector. To meet this demand, we need to effectively prepare students to enter the workforce by developing practical skills and competencies. [...] Alison Stokes 2014-07-08T14:51:38+00:00 2014-07-08T14:51:38+00:00 Accessible Field Course at GSA 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOLSOC-HE;e434aa25.1407 Colleagues,<br><br>As part of the field programme for the 2014 GSA Annual Meeting in Vancouver, the International Association for Geoscience Diversity (http://www.theiagd.org) are offering a one day, fully inclusive and accessible field trip with two primary objectives: 1. to be a completely inclusive field-based learning experience for students with disabilities, and 2. to provide a unique opportunity for current geoscience faculty to learn how to develop field courses that accommodate students with diverse abilities. [...] Douglas Paton 2014-04-11T22:09:06+01:00 2014-04-11T22:09:06+01:00 FW: [OWNERS-ANNOUNCE] Issue affecting Yahoo email subscribers to lists https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOLSOC-HE;f82d9d5c.1404 HI everybody, if you are a yahoo user, please see the note below
